intro: Phyllagathis setotheca var. setotuba, commonly known as the hairy-leaved phyllagathis, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a dense covering of fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
